mark down.ex-kor: 여성용 모자는 좀 비쌉니다. 하지만, 때가 타면 가격을 내려야 하죠.
mark down.ex-eng: The ladies' hats are kind of expensive. But when they get dirty, we have to mark them down.

have butterflies in one's stomach.ex-kor: 비자 인터뷰를 할 때 가슴이 두근거렸다.
have butterflies in one's stomach.ex-eng: I had butterflies in my stomach at the visa interview.

to go.ex-kor: 가지고 가실 거에요, 아니면 여기서 드실 거에요?

on hand.ex-kor: 그 여자는 가지고 있는 천으로 기저귀를 만들었다.
on hand.ex-eng: She made a diaper from cloth that was on hand.

go Dutch.ex-kor: 각자가 모두 자기 몫을 따로 내겠다고 했지만, 내가 다 냈다.
go Dutch.ex-eng: Everybody insisted on going Dutch, but I took care of the tab.

boil down.ex-kor: 시간이 거의 다 되어갑니다. 견해를 요약해서 말씀해 주십시오.
boil down.ex-eng: Our time is running out. Please boil down your view on this subject.

split with.ex-kor: 그는 7년간 결혼 생활을 해온 그의 아내와 갈라섰다.
split with.ex-eng: He split with his wife of seven years of marriage.

ring a bell.ex-kor: 세탁소를 한다고 하던데, 혹시 생각이 나십니까?
ring a bell.ex-eng: He owns a laundry shop. Does that ring a bell?

vanish into thin air.ex-kor: Lee를 못 본 지 2년이나 됐네. 그야말로 감쪽같이 사라진 것 같아.
vanish into thin air.ex-eng: I haven't seen Lee for two years. He seems to have just vanished into thin air.

have the nerve to do something.ex-kor: 자네가 감히 나에게 일하는 방법을 가르치겠다는 건가?
have the nerve to do something.ex-eng: You mean you have the nerve to tell me how to do my job?

in the same boat.ex-kor: 어디 자네뿐인가? 우리가 모두 같은 처지인데. 그러니 그만 투덜거리게.
in the same boat.ex-eng: You're not alone. We are all in the same boat. So stop complaining.

pooch.ex-eng: Here, pooch. Ah, that's a good boy.

be stuck-up.ex-kor: 전에는 그 여자가 거만하다고 생각했는데, 그 여자를 알게 되고 나서는 수줍어서 그런 것뿐임을 알게 되었다.
be stuck-up.ex-eng: I had always thought she was stuck-up, but once I got to know her I realized that she was only shy.

long shot.ex-kor: 거의 가망 없는 일이긴 하지만, 할 수 있는 한 열심히 공부하면 혹시 하버드대학교에 들어갈 수 있을지 모르지.
long shot.ex-eng: It's a long shot, but if you study hard enough you just might get into Harvard University.

on the house.ex-kor: 우리 가게에서 물건을 사주셔서 감사합니다. 이것은 그냥 드리는 겁니다.
on the house.ex-eng: Thank you for shopping at our store. It's on the house.

medical checkup.ex-kor: 오늘 건강검진을 받으려고 병원에 갔었는데 그들은 다음 주에 하자고 미루었다.
medical checkup.ex-eng: I went to the hospital today for a medical checkup but they put me off till next week.

bottoms up.ex-kor: 사람들이 모두 술잔을 들자, 호스트가 (건배)하고 말했다.
bottoms up.ex-eng: They all raised their glasses, and the host said, (Bottoms up!)

couch potato.ex-kor: TV에 미친 사람에게 주는 상이 있다면, 내 남편이 타게 될 거야.
couch potato.ex-eng: If there were a prize for the best couch potato, my husband would win it.

fire up.ex-eng: The coach fired the team up before the game.

add up to something.ex-kor: 아무리 생각해보아도, 결국 그의 얘기는 순전히 거짓말이라는 거야.
add up to something.ex-eng: No matter how you slice it, his story adds up to a pack up lies.

lemon.ex-kor: 그가 시내 딜러에게서 산 자동차는 알고 보니 결함 있는 자동차였다.
lemon.ex-eng: The car he bought from the downtown dealer turned out to be a lemon.

get off with a warning.ex-kor: 그 영화배우는 속도위반으로 잡혔으나, 경고만 받고 처벌을 면했다.
get off with a warning.ex-eng: The movie actor got caught speeding, but got off with a warning.

out of hand.ex-kor: 그건 내가 경솔하게 대답해줄 수가 없어.
out of hand.ex-eng: I can't answer that out of hand.

phenomenal.ex-kor: 그간 우리 노력의 결과는 참으로 괄목할 만하다.
phenomenal.ex-eng: The upshot of all our efforts is really phenomenal.

econ.ex-eng: I don't mind other subjects, but I hate econ.

educated guess.ex-kor: 내 경험에 의한 추측인데, 그런 차에 대한 보험료는 500달러는 넘을 거야.
educated guess.ex-eng: My educated guess is that insurance for a car of that sort would easily run over five hundred dollars.

stick around.ex-kor: 좀 더 근처에 있어보면, 곧 자리가 날거야.
stick around.ex-eng: I think if you'll stick around, you'll get a seat sooner or later.

weather the storm.ex-eng: Many companies failed to weather the storm.

chic.ex-kor: 그 여자보다 더 옷을 고상하게 입는 여자를 본 일이 없다.
chic.ex-eng: I've never seen anyone chicquer than she is.

oversight.ex-kor: 그 정부 고위관리는 개인 심부름을 시키기 위해 관용차를 사용하라고 한 것은 고의는 아니지만 자기의 실수라고 시인했다.
oversight.ex-eng: The high-ranking government official admitted that the use of government vehicle for personal errands was an oversight on his part.

tell on.ex-kor: 경찰관 사이에서는 동료의 잘못을 고자질하지 않는 것이 불문율로 되어 있다.
tell on.ex-eng: Among police officers it is an unwritten rule not to tell on colleagues.

stereotype.ex-kor: 대부분의 경제학자는 고정관념에 사로잡혀서, 70년대 초에 일어난 스태그플레이션을 설명하지 못했다.
stereotype.ex-eng: Trapped by their stereotypes most economists could not explain the stagflation of the early seventies.

old timer.ex-eng: Johnson is an old-timer in this company.

bite the bullet.ex-kor: 결혼한다고 들었어. 언제 그런 각오를 했어?
bite the bullet.ex-eng: I hear you're getting married. When did you decide to bite the bullet?

get credit for.ex-kor: 그는 한 번도 그 공을 인정받은 일이 없다.
get credit for.ex-eng: He's never gotten credit for that.

hit the books.ex-eng: I've got to go home, and hit the books.

lose sleep over.ex-kor: 투자한 것에 대해 공연히 고민하지 마라
lose sleep over.ex-eng: Don't lose any sleep over your investments.

freebie.ex-eng: Coffee and soft drinks are complimentary.

pampering.ex-eng: I'm afraid you're pampering your children.

be in the doghouse.ex-kor: 어제 아내의 생일을 잊었기 때문에 아내와 사이가 서먹서먹해졌다.
be in the doghouse.ex-eng: I'm in the doghouse with my wife for forgetting her birthday yesterday.

give weight.ex-kor: 자네 직함을 적어 넣게. 무게가 있어 보일 테니.
give weight.ex-eng: Why don't you use your official title? It'll give a little more weight.

bite head off.ex-kor: 그 친구 오늘 좀 이상하지 않아? 그냥 아침 인사를 했을 뿐인데 막 대들지 뭐야.
bite head off.ex-eng: What's eating him today? I only said good morning and he almost bit my head off.

mom-and-pop store.ex-kor: 그는 뉴욕에서 조그만 캔디 가게를 하고 있다.
mom-and-pop store.ex-eng: He owns a mom-and-pop candy store in New York.

obnoxious.ex-kor: 어찌나 그 여자가 못되게 구는지 죽이고 싶었어.
obnoxious.ex-eng: She was so obnoxious I could almost kill her.

just like that.ex-kor: 그렇게 간단히 저를 써 주시는 겁니까?
just like that.ex-eng: You put me on just like that?

get sick and tired of hearing.ex-kor: 월급이 적다는 그의 불평을 귀가 따갑도록 들었다.
get sick and tired of hearing.ex-eng: I got sick and tired of hearing him complaining about salary.

gullible.ex-eng: Women are so gullible and easily fooled.

on one's good side.ex-eng: He's on the boss's good side.

pain in the neck.ex-kor: 이 차는 정말 사람을 화나게 하는군.
pain in the neck.ex-eng: This car is a real pain in the neck.

the do's and don't's.ex-kor: 사규의 상당 부분이 내게도 별로 의미가 없다고 생각해.
the do's and don't's.ex-eng: I must admit that a lot of the do's and don't's don't make much sense to me, either.

company time.ex-kor: He got fired playing chess on company time.

any time soon.ex-kor: 비가 금세 멎을 것 같지 않아.
any time soon.ex-eng: The rain is not going to stop any time soon.

put a person on hold.ex-kor: 교환수는 나를 잠시 기다리게 하고, 손님을 찾는 동안 음악을 틀어줬다.
put a person on hold.ex-eng: The operator put me on hold, and played music while paging the guest.

unwind.ex-kor: 어디 가서 한잔하며 기분 좀 풀까?
unwind.ex-eng: Shall we go somewhere for a few drinks to unwind?

die down.ex-kor: 전쟁이 일어날 것이라는 세상 사람들의 말이 결국에는 수그러질 것이다.
die down.ex-eng: All this talk about war will eventually die out.

change the baby.ex-kor: 나는 아기 기저귀를 갈 거에요. 당신도 옷 갈아입지 않겠어요?
change the baby.ex-eng: I'm going to change the baby. Won't you change?

lose it.ex-eng: I think I am going to lose it!
